name: power
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: ability to control people and events

example.eg: I've no power over him - he does what he wants to.
example.egtrans: 我管不了他——他想干什么就干什么。

example.eg: Once nicotine has you in its power, it's very difficult to stop smoking.
example.egtrans: 一旦尼古丁对你起了作用，戒烟就很难了。

example.eg: She has the power to charm any man she meets.
example.egtrans: 她有魅力令她碰见的每个男子都神魂颠倒。

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of political control a person or group has in a country

example.eg: Does the president have more power than the prime minister?
example.egtrans: 总统是否比总理权力更大？

example.eg: How long has the Conservative Party been in power?
example.egtrans: 保守党当政多久了？

example.eg: The army seized power after five days of anti-government demonstrations.
example.egtrans: 反政府示威5天后，军方夺取了政权。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: Our car doesn't have enough power to tow a trailer.
example.egtrans: 我们的轿车功率不够大，拖不动拖车。

example.eg: Weightlifters have tremendous power in their arms and legs.
example.egtrans: 举重运动员的臂力和腿力极大。

example.eg: Scientists are working to harness the power of the atom.
example.egtrans: 科学家们正在研究如何利用原子能。

example.eg: The economic power of many Asian countries has grown dramatically in recent years.
example.egtrans: 近年来许多亚洲国家的经济实力有了显著的增长。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an official or legal right to do something

example.eg: I'd like to help but I don't have the power to intervene in this dispute.
example.egtrans: 我很想帮忙，但我无权介入此纠纷。

example.eg: It's not in your power to cancel the order.
example.egtrans: 你无权取消这份订单。

example.eg: I can't give you a refund - I'm afraid it's not within my power.
example.egtrans: 我不能给你退款——这恐怕不在我的职权范围内。

example.eg: You were acting beyond your powers when you agreed to give her a pay rise.
example.egtrans: 你答应给她加薪，这是在越权行事。

example.eg: Visitors to the city are respectfully reminded of the council's powers to remove illegally parked vehicles.
example.egtrans: 到该市游览的游客收到礼貌的提醒，市政委员会有权拖走违章停放的车辆。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: electricity, especially when considering its use or production

example.eg: You should disconnect the power before attempting to repair electrical equipment.
example.egtrans: 在检修电气设备之前应先切断电源。

example.eg: Our building lost power (= the electricity was stopped) during the storm.
example.egtrans: 暴风雨中我们的房子断电了。

example.eg: power cables/lines
example.egtrans: 电缆／线

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a natural skill or an ability to do something

example.eg: He was so shocked by what happened to his parents that he lost the power of speech.
example.egtrans: 发生在他父母身上的事使他惊呆了，他一句话也说不出来。

example.eg: The surgeon did everything in her power to save him.
example.egtrans: 医生竭尽全力抢救他。

example.eg: My mental powers aren't as good as they used to be.
example.egtrans: 我的脑力不如以前了。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person, organization, or country that has control over others, often because of wealth, importance, or great military strength
trans_examp.trans_cn: 掌握大权的人；有影响力的机构；强国

example.eg: Spain was an important military power in the 16th century.
example.egtrans: 西班牙在16世纪是一个军事强国。

example.eg: Germany is on its way to becoming a world power with a permanent seat on the UN Security Council.
example.egtrans: 德国正在努力成为世界强国，谋求成为联合国安理会常任理事国。

example.eg: She is an increasingly important power in the company.
example.egtrans: 在公司中她的权力越来越大。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the rate at which energy is used, or the ability to produce energy

example.eg: The ship was only slightly damaged in the collision and was able to sail into port under its own power.
example.egtrans: 船在撞击中只是轻微受损，仍可依靠自身的动力驶入港口。

example.eg: The power rating of my amplifier is 40 watts per channel.
example.egtrans: 我的扬声器的功率（级别）是每声道40瓦。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount by which an image is increased by a device used for seeing things that are very small or a long distance away

example.eg: What's the magnification power of your binoculars?
example.egtrans: 你的双筒望远镜的放大倍数是多少？

example.eg: You'll need a very high-power microscope to see something as small as that.
example.egtrans: 要观察那么小的东西，你需要一台高倍显微镜。

example.eg: A low-power telescope is enough if you only want to look at the moon.
example.egtrans: 只观看月相用低倍望远镜就足够了。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the number of times that a number is to be multiplied by itself

example.eg: 2 to the fourth power is 2 times 2 times 2 times 2, which equals 16.
example.egtrans: 2的4次方就是2乘2乘2乘2，等于16。

example.eg: 3 to the power 4 is usually written as 34.
example.egtrans: 3的4次方通常写作34。

name: power
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to provide a machine with energy and the ability to operate

example.eg: Buses and trucks are usually powered by diesel engines.
example.egtrans: 公共汽车和卡车通常是由柴油机驱动的。

example.eg: Electricity costs less than petrol, so powering an electric vehicle is cheaper.
example.egtrans: 电比汽油的成本低，所以电动力车会比较省钱。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to act with great strength or in a forceful way

example.eg: Halfway through, she powered into the lead and went on to win the race.
example.egtrans: 到半程时，她加速冲到前面，一直领先，赢得了赛跑冠军。
